ruby-align-property.name: ruby-align
ruby-align-property.summary: The ruby-align CSS property defines the distribution of the different ruby elements over the base.

ie.notes: Internet Explorer 9 and later supports an earlier draft of CSS Ruby with non-standard values for this property: auto, left, center, right, distribute-letter, distribute-space, and line-edge.

ruby-align-property.title: ruby-align

rubypos.name: ruby-position
rubypos.summary: The ruby-position CSS property defines the position of a ruby element relatives to its base element. It can be positioned over the element (over), under it (under), or between the characters on their right side (inter-character).

chrome.notes: Implemented as a non-standard, prefixed, version of ruby-position, -webkit-ruby-position: it has two properties: before and after (both equivalent, for ltr and rtl scripts to the standard over value used with ruby-align: start).

ie.notes: Internet Explorer 9 and later support an old draft values: inline (equivalent of having display: inline on the ruby), and above (synonym of the modern over).

safari.notes: Implemented as a non-standard, prefixed, version of ruby-position, -webkit-ruby-position: it has two properties: before and after (both equivalent, for ltr and rtl scripts to the standard over value used with ruby-align: start).

edge_blink.notes: Implemented as a non-standard, prefixed, version of ruby-position, -webkit-ruby-position: it has two properties: before and after (both equivalent, for ltr and rtl scripts to the standard over value used with ruby-align: start).

rubypos.title: ruby-position
